info.author: WardPearce
info.description:
## Install
Install git and run ``pip3 install git+https://github.com/WardPearce/aioshoppy.git``

[Shoppy's Documentation](https://shoppy.dev/)

## Index
[API](#api)
[Example](#example)

### API
##### aioshoppy.client
``aioshoppy.client(api_key, session=None)``

- If you aren't passing a ``aiohttp.ClientSession`` object created within the event loop ``aioshoppy.client`` should be ran within the context of the loop.
- Anything what has a '.' in it replace it with '__'.

##### aioshoppy.client(...).product(self, product_id=None)
    - list(self, page: int = 1)
    - get(self)
    - create(self, **kwargs)
    - update(self, **kwargs)
    - delete(self)
##### aioshoppy.client(...).product(self, product_id=None).image(self)
    - update(self, file)
    - delete(self)
##### aioshoppy.client(...).order(self, order_id=None)
    - list(self, page: int = 1)
    - get(self)
##### aioshoppy.client(...).feedback(self, feedback_id=None)
    - list(self, page: int = 1)
    - get(self)
##### aioshoppy.client(...).query(self, query_id=None)
    - list(self, page: int = 1)
    - get(self)
    - update(self, action)
    - reply(self, message)
##### aioshoppy.client(...).websocket(self, webhook_secret)
    - validate(self, headers, payload, incoming_ip=None)
##### aioshoppy.client(...).payment(self).v1(self)
    - create(self, **kwargs)
    - delete(self, payment_id)
##### aioshoppy.client(...).payment(self).v2(self)
    - create(self, **kwargs)
    - white_label(self, return_url, gateway, **kwargs)

### Example
```py
import aioshoppy
import asyncio

async def example():
    shoppy = aioshoppy.client(api_key="")

    print(await shoppy.payment.v2.white_label(
        return_url="https://example.com/return", 
        gateway="BTC",
        title="Amazing Example",
        value=10,
        email="example@gmail.com"))

    await shoppy.session.close()

loop = asyncio.get_event_loop()
loop.run_until_complete(example())
loop.close()
```

Install

Install git and run pip3 install git+https://github.com/WardPearce/aioshoppy.git

Shoppy's Documentation

Index

API Example

API

aioshoppy.client

aioshoppy.client(api_key, session=None)

  • If you aren't passing a aiohttp.ClientSession object created within the event loop aioshoppy.client should be ran within the context of the loop.
  • Anything what has a '.' in it replace it with '__'.
aioshoppy.client(...).product(self, product_id=None)
- list(self, page: int = 1)
- get(self)
- create(self, **kwargs)
- update(self, **kwargs)
- delete(self)
aioshoppy.client(...).product(self, product_id=None).image(self)
- update(self, file)
- delete(self)
aioshoppy.client(...).order(self, order_id=None)
- list(self, page: int = 1)
- get(self)
aioshoppy.client(...).feedback(self, feedback_id=None)
- list(self, page: int = 1)
- get(self)
aioshoppy.client(...).query(self, query_id=None)
- list(self, page: int = 1)
- get(self)
- update(self, action)
- reply(self, message)
aioshoppy.client(...).websocket(self, webhook_secret)
- validate(self, headers, payload, incoming_ip=None)
aioshoppy.client(...).payment(self).v1(self)
- create(self, **kwargs)
- delete(self, payment_id)
aioshoppy.client(...).payment(self).v2(self)
- create(self, **kwargs)
- white_label(self, return_url, gateway, **kwargs)

Example

import aioshoppy
import asyncio

async def example():
    shoppy = aioshoppy.client(api_key="")

    print(await shoppy.payment.v2.white_label(
        return_url="https://example.com/return", 
        gateway="BTC",
        title="Amazing Example",
        value=10,
        email="example@gmail.com"))

    await shoppy.session.close()

loop = asyncio.get_event_loop()
loop.run_until_complete(example())
loop.close()
